abstract: Researchers said the number of plug-in hybrids in the United States could reach 40 million by 2030, but only with big subsidies and rapid technology progress.
snippet: Researchers said the number of plug-in hybrids in the United States could reach 40 million by 2030, but only with big subsidies and rapid technology progress.
lead_paragraph: Despite recent excitement about a type of electric car called a plug-in hybrid, such vehicles are unlikely to arrive in meaningful numbers for a few more decades, according to new analysis by the National Research Council.

headline.main: Study Says Big Impact of the Plug-In Hybrid Will Be Decades Away
headline.print_headline: Study Says Big Impact Of the Plug-In Hybrid Will Be Decades Away

byline.original: By Jad Mouawad and Kate Galbraith
